p: Furthermore, high conductivity values reinforced the characterization of the formulation as an O/W system, since this parameter indicates the external phase characteristic of the emulsion [ 21]. The BBE showed a high conductivity value (1932.00 ± 10.15 µS·cm −1), which indicates an external aqueous phase, similar to the water conductivity and characteristic of the oil-in-water (O/W) emulsions [ 21]. In addition, this data did not change significantly throughout the stability study (1848.33 ± 42.72 µS·cm −1), indicating no phase inversion, phase separation, or degradation of oil droplets.
